availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Organized at Camp Calhoun at Calhoun, Kentucky, on December 12, 1861. Mustered out at Bowling Green, Kentucky, on December 16, 1864. Recruits and veterans were transferred to the 6th Veteran Cavalry Regiment. Commander(s): Colonel Percival "Pierce" Butler Hawkins, Colonel Smoloff Palace Love, and Lt. Colonel Erasmus L. Mottley.

ab.bibl:
Frederick Henry Dyer, A Compendium of the War of the Rebellion, (Des Moines: Dyer Publishing Company, 1908), p. 148.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 824-40, 925.
